Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
heavy-handed \heavy-handed\ adj. 1. same as {ham-fisted}.
Syn: bumbling, bungling, butterfingered, ham-fisted, ham-handed, handless, left-handed. [WordNet 1.5]
2. unjustly harsh or domineering; as, incensed at the government's heavy-handed economic policies.
Syn: harsh, roughshod. [WordNet 1.5]

heavy-handed adj 1: not skillful in physical movement especially with the hands; "a bumbling mechanic"; "a bungling performance"; "ham-handed governmental interference"; "could scarcely empty a scuttle of ashes, so handless was the poor creature"- Mary H. Vorse [syn: {bumbling}, {bungling}, {butterfingered}, {ham-fisted}, {ham-handed}, {handless}, {left-handed}] 2: unjustly domineering; "incensed at the government's heavy-handed economic economic policies"; "a manager who rode roughshod over all opposition" [syn: {roughshod}]
